On Wed, 21 Sep 2005 22:56:34 +0200, Bradley, Todd  
<todd.bradley@...> wrote:

> Jason Rogers wrote:
>> But, you fail to consider that for some people (especially in
>> different
>> cultures) the first way to help yourself may be to ask a
>> question.
>
> I can't get my brain around that statement.  How
> can "asking a question" (which must include a 2nd
> party) be "helping yourself" (which cannot include a
> 2nd party)?

So you have never been talking to someone, and when you are formulating a  
question, find the answer to it yourself? I can't begin to count the  
number of times students of mine are about to ask a question, and find the  
answer to it them self. Often when you try to explain a challenge  
(problem) you have, the brain connects the dots... Thinking out loud is  
often a good thing.

-- 
Stein Erik Berget
